channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @bernstein_judah Oddly, Orthodox communal leaders have gotten decreasingly wise about such matters over the decades.
Maxwell House aimed small in getting a hechsher on their coffee beans. They should have gotten rabbinic approval to do as the below tweet suggests. https://t.co/N2tcpjkC2T
@ParkerMolloy @AstroKatie That’s what dental records are for. And subcutaneous chips.

@AstroKatie @ParkerMolloy I flip between the two modes of “gender is nobody’s business except on dating apps” and “gender is fine but please don’t ask me to remember yours; I need the brain space to remember where I parked my car.”

@BluehairCoffee @euthyphro People don’t like being made uncomfortable by the papers they own, read, or advertise in. So as the truth gets more uncomfortable to people whose identity is tied up in being Conservative, there will be less truth in rye paper.
@euthyphro @BluehairCoffee Consider the strong possibility that these views are held by the owners of the paper.

@AkivaMCohen I suspect that big-city contractors who know how to transform commercial space into residential will do very well in the coming years. Particularly if they can retrofit for climate concerns.
Your occasional reminder that we conducted no research before deciding that "Holocaust education" should be widely delivered to young Jewish children. https://t.co/tu8MMX2eTy
@AngryBlackLady Thank you for the good analogy. And there are probably people who should be getting chemotherapy but aren't because they don't have proper medical care to diagnose appropriately.
"I'm pro-abortion to the extent a person needs one, just like I'm pro-chemo to the extent a person needs it." https://t.co/pucnPkE62y

Short, fascinating piece about the emotional difference between writing a heart-rending memoir and narrating it for the audio book. At least if, like Wil Wheaton, you're a professional actor. https://t.co/Hzhysy1xEz
@adamjohnsonNYC So they're advocating for bike lanes?
@_MAArgentino I admire your ambition in writing about a new religion in its very early, fast-evolving stages!
@SamuelSpinner For kids the right age, that’s perfect….
@danfriedmanme @NUFC @premierleague @JuddLegum Great moments in yeshiva high school graduates.
Todays reminder that police don’t see their job as public safety: Bayonne officer brushed aside warnings that that an armed would-be murderer was coming to town. https://t.co/A4i0AwdKSU
@giligetz Certainly one way to combat hasbara.
@OMTorah @NTarnopolsky @GLZRadio That would be the real burn.

@DandiaAsad Call me when the “collapse” of Gotham halves rents in the city. And then perhaps I’ll be able to end my Jersey sojourn.
@DandiaAsad Rent aside, Manhattan is a pretty great place to be working remotely.

Good thing coastal cities face no threats in the years ahead https://t.co/K975gcG0tN
https://t.co/3NyiNfrAdl
Classic parenting hack. https://t.co/8Ci1Y4JXNW
@DemocraticLuntz @MisfitTorah I’m going to assume Cleveland’s Hebrew Academy, the school I didn’t go to, taught navi in the 70s until I hear evidence to the contrary.
@lrozen I would hope so. My reaction to the initial reports last week was: Wow! Talk about self-starters taking the initiative!
@MisfitTorah Consider that a cautionary tale in attending a non-Orthodox day school for fifth and sixth grades. My Hebrew is great but my Shoftim and Shmuel is shoddy.
